data.what_is:
Act-On Software provides solutions that empower marketers to engage marketing targets at every step of the customer lifecycle. Act-On makes customer data actionable so marketers can dream big and build smart, effective marketing automation programs to grow their businesses and generate higher customer lifetime value - all with the fastest time-to-value.

Get a Demo: https://act-on.com/demo/

Act-On empowers marketers to:

*	Grow and expand their businesses at scale through B2B demand generation, B2C sales and transactions, and customer marketing features. Orchestrate and optimize the entire customer journey -- from awareness to advocacy -- by building continuous, customized engagement that transforms visitors into prospects, prospects into qualified leads, and qualified leads into lifetime customers.

*	Deliver exceptional brand experiences throughout the customer lifecycle by automating buying journeys, personalizing communications and campaigns, and improving brand affinity and loyalty. Leverage Act-On's automated capabilities to attract new prospects, engage your contacts, and guide leads toward more frequent and more lucrative purchasing decisions.

*	Drive measurable product adoption and customer retention through executing comprehensive onboarding and training programs, product adoption and customer retention strategies, and new products and services promotions. From new contacts to loyal partners, you can use Act-On to engage your audience, turn them into brand ambassadors, and keep them coming back for more. 

With interactive and dynamic reporting and analytics to assess, showcase, and improve performance, the Act-On Platform is designed to deliver growth marketing value for businesses and marketers of any size, shape, location, and scale.   

Platform features include:

*	Automated and adaptable buying journeys
*	Deep integrations with leading CRM systems and web conferencing
*	Website visitor engagement tracking and intent reporting
*	Dynamic lead scoring, segmenting, and nurturing
*	Social media listening, prospecting, publishing, and advocacy
*	Easy-to-design web forms, landing pages, and email templates
*	Event-triggered and transactional emailing
*	Active contact-based pricing for actual usage billing

We get marketing. We understand your challenges. And we're here to help you excel with every customer and every campaign.

initial_reviews.review_title: Seamless Implementation and Exceptional Support with Act-On
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I recently implemented Act-On for our marketing automation needs, and I couldn't be happier with the decision. The ease of use is outstanding; the intuitive interface made it simple for our team to get up and running quickly without a steep learning curve. The implementation process was impressively fast, allowing us to start leveraging the platform's robust features in no time.

What truly sets Act-On apart is its exceptional technical support. The support team is always there when we need them, providing quick and effective solutions to any questions or challenges we encounter. Their dedication to customer service has been a game-changer for us.

Act-On has significantly enhanced our marketing capabilities, and I highly recommend it to any organization looking for a reliable and user-friendly marketing automation solution.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I have worked with other similar companies in the past and I am happy that I made the move to Act-on so I really don't have any complaints at this time

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Managing all our email marketing automation and analytics

initial_reviews.review_title: Always Willing to Listen

One of the best reasons to work with Act-On is that everyone from dev to client success managers to the deliverability team listens to the end user to make improvements and offer enhancements. I have worked with Act-On for 10 years now to send daily emails in multiple instances and am consistently impressed.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Two things:
1. There are a lot of things within Act-On that I have not been shown how to use and therefore do not understand. There seems to be a lot of unused potential. Whenever I sign up for Act-On webinars to learn more about a feature, what I'm wanting (a step-by-step show of the tools I'm interested) is never fulfilled, but rather a lengthy powerpoint that brings more confusion and frustration. I wish there were clear "how-to" videos for various tools that showed someone on the Act-On homepage.
2. There are a few limitations in Act-On that I have not seen in other platforms such as Mailchimp. Especially within the realm of email creation, I'll bring up things to our email developer and he will say "we're not able to do that with Act-On", which just brings frustration.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On is giving me good input on the customer and what the customer wants and what they're buying. It's helpful to have most of the data I need in one place (I also use GA4 for purchase data).

What do you like best about Act-On?

Our organization is committed to staying with NetSuite and finding other vendors that natively integrate with the CRM has been a challenge. Act-On does that without the need for a third-party data integrator and has made consistent improvements to the connector, expanding the amount of data that can be passed between the systems.

Also, over the past 7 years of working with Act-On, I have nothing but good things to say about their support team. Whether over chat, phone calls, or support tickets, issues are resolved in a timely manner and escalated promptly to engineering when a more technical solution is needed.

Our Customer Success Manager at Act-On is a wonderful resource as well, ensuring we're always current on platform updates, have opportunities to beta new features, and have the resources needed to be successful on the platform.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Native reporting and analytics built into the platform have been a point of concern--particularly with the ability to aggregate data. Before adding on the Data Studio feature, we had to do a lot of manual data aggregation to measure initiatives. However, there have been recent significant improvements to this that show an acknowledgment of the need to customize reporting.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On allows us to communicate with our customer base and our prospects at scale and in an automated manner to support and align with our sales and business goals.

Plus, we frequently participate in third-party emails with industry magazines, so creating the emails within Act-on and then downloading the HTML files are critical and a huge timesaver.

all_reviews.review_title: Helpful in the basics, but a lot of unused potential
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I appreciate Act-On's general clarity of usage. For the things I know how to do, I can always clearly see a path to them, and I am able to figure out different questions I have about the things I know using the tools Act-On presents.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Two things:
1. There are a lot of things within Act-On that I have not been shown how to use and therefore do not understand. There seems to be a lot of unused potential. Whenever I sign up for Act-On webinars to learn more about a feature, what I'm wanting (a step-by-step show of the tools I'm interested) is never fulfilled, but rather a lengthy powerpoint that brings more confusion and frustration. I wish there were clear "how-to" videos for various tools that showed someone on the Act-On homepage.
2. There are a few limitations in Act-On that I have not seen in other platforms such as Mailchimp. Especially within the realm of email creation, I'll bring up things to our email developer and he will say "we're not able to do that with Act-On", which just brings frustration.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On is giving me good input on the customer and what the customer wants and what they're buying. It's helpful to have most of the data I need in one place (I also use GA4 for purchase data).

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent commitment to customer success and CRM integration
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The out-of-the-box integration with the NetSuite CRM is a game-changer for us. Our organization is committed to staying with NetSuite and finding other vendors that natively integrate with the CRM has been a challenge. Act-On does that without the need for a third-party data integrator and has made consistent improvements to the connector, expanding the amount of data that can be passed between the systems.

Also, over the past 7 years of working with Act-On, I have nothing but good things to say about their support team. Whether over chat, phone calls, or support tickets, issues are resolved in a timely manner and escalated promptly to engineering when a more technical solution is needed.

Our Customer Success Manager at Act-On is a wonderful resource as well, ensuring we're always current on platform updates, have opportunities to beta new features, and have the resources needed to be successful on the platform.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Native reporting and analytics built into the platform have been a point of concern--particularly with the ability to aggregate data. Before adding on the Data Studio feature, we had to do a lot of manual data aggregation to measure initiatives. However, there have been recent significant improvements to this that show an acknowledgment of the need to customize reporting.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On allows us to communicate with our customer base and our prospects at scale and in an automated manner to support and align with our sales and business goals.

all_reviews.review_title: Great eMarketing platform with plenty of features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I like the ability to segment based on behavioral data, such as what pages a customer clicked, what emails they opened, etc. The technical support is also beneficial and resolves all of my problems. I have had some complicated ones, and they escalated them right up to senior engineers. I also like the GUI and how easy it is to find what I'm looking for quickly. The data on clicks/opens/etc is also easily accessible in both a broad overview format and a downloaded report, making creating more in-depth custom reporting very easy. Act-on also provides a good top level overview of how well our marketing efforts have done each month, while comparing the current month to the previous two months. this makes it easy to spot trends in opens/clicks.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I want more control over handling multiple eNurture programs that are simultaneously running at the same time. Such as more straightforward ways to detect if a recipient is in one program and then hold off on sending them emails from another until they finish the first program. While I enjoy the GUI for the most part, one thing that did catch me up when I first started using Act-on was finding where form submissions and other marketing lists where. Often, there's content that appears duplicated (EG: folders will show up for form submissions when there are no form submissions in those folders). I've used Act-on long enough that I can navigate to whatever I want very easily, but it can be hard for new users to find everything at first.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-on is solving the issue of building complicated and very specific nurture campaigns targeted to very granulated segments. This allows emails to be much more tailored to the individual recipient. Some benefits I have seen include the automated program builder, which was recently upgraded to show a more visual approach to how steps would take recipients depending on their actions. A big benefit for us is that Act-on intergrates with Microsoft CRM. This way, our sales team can easily click and view a lead or contact's activity history on our website to help give them a better context when contacting them. Email fatigue rules allow us to set the amount of emails recieved by a user in a current time span, to help avoid opt outs. Segment criteria is also very helpful, and can be drilled down to very specific actions, making segmentation very specific.

I wish there was a way to see what images in your media library were actually being used and what images are not connected to either a landing page, email, etc. It would be nice to have an easy way to be able to clean up what is not being used. I also wish there was a little more HTML functionality to try and steer the landing pages we create on ActOn to better align with our current website design/look and feel. Sometimes you can see a disconnect but there is nothing you can do to fix it.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use ActOn for all of our email marketing as well as for landing pages and forms on our website to be contacted by us and also to protect all of our gated content. With the metrics and ability to track what goes on we are able to show management real ROI, help our sales team grow their pipeline, and bring metrics that help our team make better decisions more quickly.

all_reviews.review_title: Very Helpful with All of My Questions
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On helps you with dynamic tools to make your automated email campaigns come to life. If there is something in your email campaign that is more complex than what is given to you, Act-On will look into it for you and see if they would build it out for you. They want their customers to succeed in their marketing efforts and will look for many ways to optimize your account too.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
There are not many dislikes I have with Act-On. If I had to choose, I would say that their help articles need some work. I try my best to go there first before I go into their live chat rooms, but some of the articles don't answer my question, or the content in the help article is confusing at times. Other than that, it is solid!

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Act-On is definitely a go-to source of marketing automation if you are looking to send multiple emails monthly to the same contacts. Act-On only counts active unique contacts for your monthly limit, not the total contacts. From my little research, other competitors will only count the total contacts you signed up for.

Act-On is also a good tool for those that work at enterprise levels.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
There is an internal newsletter that we have started sending out back in May 2020. Before that, our CEO would share some company-wide news. Since he was sending them through our email client, we didn't have a way to track who is engaging with the content. We decided to rebrand the news with a bi-weekly newsletter that went through Act-On to the whole company. We were able to gain some amazing insights on where people were clicking throughout the newsletter. With that in place, we could make smarter strategic decisions on what the next content should be.

Another problem we had was the lack of following up with strong leads from our campaigns. Act-On wasn't always connected to our CRM, so our customer lists were not the most accurate. Since our sales reps work through the CRM, they couldn't determine who was a strong lead. Now that we are connected with our CRM to Act-On, we are able to perform automated email campaigns and send CRM tasks out to those that complete certain call-to-actions.

This has made our communication efforts more efficient than ever before. Very thankful for that.

all_reviews.review_title: Does everything we need it to do, and then some
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On brings together all the tools we need in a marketing automation platform: email, contact lists and segmentation, lead nurturing and scoring, landing pages, webinars, automated programs, drip campaigns, social media marketing, and account based marketing. It's easy to learn, use, administer and manage. Act-On customer and technical support are second to none, truly best-in-class.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The interface is inconsistent in spots, such as the design tools for emails versus landing pages. HTML layout is also sometimes not "what you see is what you get" -- you get different renderings in different email clients and browsers. Lead scoring is a little complicated. Contacts are kept in lists, which multiply like crazy; would prefer access to underlying database.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
List your requirements, get a demo, attend training, try it out for a month or two - you'll likely find Act-On ticks all the boxes and very easy to use.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
1) Email marketing and overall list management in compliance with GDPR - biggest benefit is having everything in one place, sharing tools and knowledge across a global organization. 2) Webinar campaigns via Webex integration within Act-On - the reports give us detailed visibility into registrants and attendees. 3) Social Media Marketing via Act-On's Advanced Social Module -- scheduling and tracking posts across sites is a breeze. 4) CRM integration (Salesforce.com) - two-way exchange of contacts and leads so Sales and Marketing always share the latest information, eliminates need for exporting, importing, uploading, downloading.

Our customer success manager is a go-to resource not just for trouble shooting but for brainstorming how to execute against our strategic goals. Most of all, Act-On doesn't treat us as a number; they respect us as a client and always go the extra mile because they value us as a business partner.

Act-On is a type of company you don't come across often. With every feature release, brand change, or usability improvement, Act-On never fails to keep the customer top of mind and even reach out to customers for their two cents. -Create and execute both traditional and automated programs/email drips with personalizations for our marketing campaigns.
-Create separate content such as forms and landing pages for external communication with partners and customers, some of which we have set up to send data directly and automatically sends to our Sales platform, Salesforce.
-Host webinars and send automated email drips with the WebEx integration.
-Track marketing analytics (i.e. visits, leads, conversions).
-Use as our marketing contact/segment repository abiding by GDPR guidelines.

We would not be able to do any of these tasks as easily without Act-On, especially in a single platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Overly complicated, need workarounds for everything
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Honestly, I don't like any aspect of working in this tool.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
It is not intuitive, and everything is overly complicated. Particularly in the list management and automation areas, it's very different than most ESPs. There are inconsistencies in UI all over the place, and the simplest things, like double scroll bars, that create a negative customer experience are rampant. It uses something called "Stationery" instead of a template system that most email marketers are accustomed to, and you can only create it by fully writing the code from scratch. There is zero documentation on their stationary language, like you would find with other ESPs like MailChimp.

After 2+ years in this tool, I can safely say that projects take three times as long to execute in Act-On as they would in other systems. Email Marketers, save your sanity. Do not use this product. They claimed to be rolling out lots of updates to create a better UX in 2019 and 2020, but none of the updates have made any effectual difference, in my experience.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Do not choose this tool. The user experience is so painful. I find myself frustrated with something new almost daily. There are much better options out there.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
None. This tool creates more problems than it solves. I primarily use it to execute promotional and automated email campaigns, hosting gated content and hosting forms. I use the connectors to sync customer data from external POS and CRM databases. I've realized no benefits, compared to other tools.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I like the way Act-On makes it quick and simple to create content with drag-and-drop interfaces, and the easy management of automated email programmes. Act-On has helped us to create a functional and effective marketing funnel that nurtures contacts effectively and allows us to feed engaged leads through to the sales department.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
There have been occasional technical issues and bugs in the system, but they have generally been resolved fairly quickly and simply. Although I like the drag-and-drop functionality, there are some elements which are quite restricting, such as landing pages only available in a one-column design while emails can be split into three columns.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I would recommend for new users to complete the training modules and make the most of the Act-On University, as there are a lot of tricks and tips that really improve the experience and can have a big impact on the effectiveness of the tool.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our old email platform required us to manually code every single email we sent out in HTML, did not allow us to keep master contact lists, and had no functionality for automation or analytics. As such, Act-On has totally revolutionised our digital presence, and allowed us to create an email marketing strategy that would simply not have been possible before. We can keep in touch with our contacts, leads, and customers on a regular basis, and track their progression and engagement in the funnel so that when face-to-face conversations occur, Sales team members are pre-armed with everything they need to know about that contact. Act-On has and will continue to be totally instrumental in our digital strategy and pipeline development for the coming year. A bespoke integration with our native CRM platform is also going to prove essential to our sales and marketing processes.

You are also able to test for deliverability and spam scoring which is a huge lifesaver.

This isn't always a bad thing (a novice email marketer could use ActOn quite simply) but I think it limits the layout and design of campaigns if you are looking for something more complex. The way the lists are managed is good but the actual design is also a bit clunky here. I wish the design was a bit more updated.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I would recommend using ActOn if you need better analytics or are working to improve your list management. The platform is easy to use so if you don't have a lot of experience in email marketing automation you should be able to pick it up quickly. There is also great support available and training courses to help you better use the platform.

We are warming our marketing list in  ActOn to locate our most engaged leads. The analytics and reporting in Acton are very strong which has made this process very clear. The ActOn support team was also very quick to support us with many questions we had in the transition of switching our lists from the old platform to Acton.

all_reviews.review_title: A masterclass in how not to run a business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On allows you to create nicely designed emails. Deliverability is generally good.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
While using the product, was contacted multiple times by "Act-On" partners which we did not opt into. Act-On did address and remove some partners when flagged, but I have never experienced this with other similar products. The emails were constant and all specific to Act-On.

The main issue with the product is that Act-On creates dynamic links in every email (that they host) which means as soon as you cancel (we used the product for all of 2018) emails sent in the period paid for do *not* work. The only solution we were provided with was renewing. Our account manager "Stuart N" (I have not included his surname) was patronizing, unhelpful and escalated a junior marketing executive in our team to their legal department when flagging the technical issue.

In order to demonstrate the issues we had, will use an example of another SaaS product we use, Adobe:

-	We subscribe to Adobe Creative Suite (for around $100/month)
-	I create and send a Holiday Card PDF on December 25 2018 with links
-	I cancel my subscription with Adobe
-	On January 2nd, you read the email and open the PDF
-	The links would still be functional, as would the PDF, that I created using their premium product

Using Act-On:

-	I subscribe to Act-On at a 5 figure cost for the year
-	I create and send a Holiday Card email on December 25 2018 with links
-	I cancel my subscription with Act-On
-	On January 2nd, you read the email and click the link to read more
-	The links are *no longer* functional

all_reviews.review_title: A strategic tool to build successful marketing campaigns.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On's automation platform is intuitive, I like the way the menu is built, it's been made in a logical order so that when you move from one section to another, you go down the logical path to build automation.
The support team is great, they're efficient and patient ! There are many ways to find answers and tips; the Act-On community, the Act-On university, the online training courses, the webinars, everything is made for us to easily learn and efficiently use the platform.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Sometimes it takes us quite some time to do some simple, basic tasks, for example when editing a step in an automated program, we have to wait a few seconds for the system to record what we edited and allow us to move to the next step. When there are many steps, it can become frustrating. Another example is when editing an image using Act-On editor, it can take many minutes before we can see the changes on the image where it's being used (in emails, landing page, etc). These delays can be a bit frustrating when you are working on a template and you can't finish it because some of the assets are still being processed by the system.
The marketing calendar is a bit confusing sometimes, I see messages that have not been sent marked as sent, and we can only have a month view unless we export the details.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
We would advise to really define your needs and do some benchmarking; Act-On is a great tool to build segmentation, automated programs, nurturing programs and it can be integrated with many other tools, to create a great and efficient tech stack. It definitely is a tool worth having, but it requires to know where you want to go and what you want to achieve.
It took us a few months before understanding and mastering most of what you can do within the platform, and we're still learning. So be persistent and don't be afraid to "play with" and test the tool, it's totally worth it.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were able for the first time to really segment and target our audience. We saw a significant increase in our opening and click rates, we could trigger more interest by sending relevant content to our audience, and this led us to more qualified and interested leads.
Having a marketing automation tool such as Act-on is a really benefit to run successful marketing campaign. When we started using Act-On, we realized we were not as organized as we thought we were; It kind of "forced" us (in a positive way) to rethink our campaigns, how we built them and what we expected from them.
This tool allowed us to track our audience and create reports on our tasks and projects such as events, webinars, digital campaign (including google adwords, social media posts, emails, website, landing pages). It is a must-have in our marketing tech-stack.

For someone just getting started with marketing automation, this is a great system. We currently use it in conjunction with our CRM system. We also use the Advanced Social Media module as an add-on. I can't say this part of the tool is a dealbreaker for us but it's useful so that we can publish our social content all in one platform and have the analytics trace back to Act-On. They are constantly updating the platform which may be annoying to some but I think it demonstrates how they are trying to "move with the times." This is something I would not have previously called out when I first started working with them.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The Tech Support team is pretty good. They are persistent with keeping up on tickets that you open with them. However, it has taken me a couple of iterations to be able to demonstrate any bugs or issues I have with Act-On. That said, my issue may not be totally resolved until I can replicate the issue for them so that they can look into it further. Another thing to note is the somewhat revolving door of customer success managers. I am not sure if this is just the SaS industry as a whole but we tend to move from one customer success manager to another year over year. I prefer consistency in this area because otherwise I have to retell our organization's "story" over and over again when onboarding a new employee from Act-On.

all_reviews.review_title: A strategic tool to build successful marketing campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On's automation platform is intuitive, I like the way the menu is built, it's been made in a logical order so that when you move from one section to another, you go down the logical path to build automation.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Sometimes it takes us quite some times to do some simple tasks, for example when editing a step in an automated program, we have to wait a few seconds for the system to record what we edited and allow us to move to the next step. When there are many steps, it can become frustrating. Another example is when editing an image using Act-On editor, it can time many minutes before we can see the changes on the image where it's being used (in emails, landing page, etc). These delays can be a bit frustrating when you are working on a template and you can't finish it because some of the assets are still being processed by the system.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
When we started with Act-On, it was basically used for converting existing Excel reports. But later on, after exploring the features and with latest releases, it had a greater impact on the way we interact with the data. We were able to connect the data from different source of data together. We were able to relate the defects, quality and cost aspects of the products of our company from different regions in a much more efficient way. The visualizations gave a better picture of the current state of affairs and we got an idea of what needs to be improved in the line of business. Now, Act-On has become an integral part of our organization for any analytical solution.

all_reviews.review_title: We use Act-On daily with an integration with SugarCRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
One of the best things about Act-On is its organizational ability and power behind segmentation. When you have a lot of different product offerings or avenues, Act-On provides seamless data mapping and Automated Program tracking. The fluency with connecting with SugarCRM is also seamless, where it accesses Leads, Contacts, Accounts, Targets, Users, Teams, and Campaigns. Data is shared back and forth between these two systems and you have complete control over everything that happens. Act-On has recently published an API / Developer playground which has benefitted us a lot. I would recommend Act-On to any current CRM Developers or Software Development personnel who has marketing experience.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
One of the major issues with the Act-On company is their support team. Getting a valid or accurate response can be very difficult, and depending on who you talk to you will get different answers. We had one major issue with Act-On that persisted for almost two months before something was done to fix it.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
There are many alternatives to Act-On on the market. It really depends on what type of CRM system you are using.. If you have good developers and if you have the marketing personelle able to interact and work on technically diverse issues. It's not plug and play by any means, but for a technically minded person everything is very simple to deploy. You need a strong foundation for organization before you dive into a Marketing Platform as complex as Act-On. Your CRM data needs to be accurate and the stuff you pass back and forth needs to be planned and managed.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were trying to find leads for our sales team. Act-On provides a lot of different channels of marketing ability that brings us a pile of leads every week. Act-On has some awesome reporting/tracking on all of these Leads, their behaviors and interests, etc. Act-On is a great system for an experienced CRM Developer.

all_reviews.review_content:

The best part of the Act-on software is the ease at which you can view clicks, opens, and sent numbers with every email sent. Being able to easily download excel sheets with all pertinent information and data for each individual email is also extremely helpful. In addition, the ability to suppress certain lists of people in each email is very helpful, because often emails are sent multiple times to different groups of people for data tracking purposes. Another feature that has proven to be quite beneficial is the ability to keep and maintain lists of different people and groups. As a company with many different clients, and various offices it is extremely important to be able to generate and save mailing lists for different the many demographics we serve.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I often find that act-on takes a lengthy time to load from page to page. In addition to this, downloading files of data about emails sent often also are very time consuming compared to other programs.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
To others considering Act on, I would say it is a highly effective and efficient program for keeping track of mailing lists, emails sent, and all that data that comes with that. It is generally very easy to use, even with little experience in software like this. Although not always the fastest program, it has many features that make it stand out for data tracking.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-on provides the opportunity for our company to see who is consistently interacting with messages we send. With this information, it helps to build our relationships with people who are interested in us, and have similar views.

all_reviews.review_title: It helps, but its no game changer...
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The clear tracking of a customer profile, and predictive results. Tracking how often someone would open our emails, as well as the value of these results was always great. We could quickly segment users based on the number of emails they were opening, and prioritize based on the areas the users clicked. The reports and click-maps were easy to use, and provided clear data.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
We were never 100% sure of the accuracy of this program. We would reach out to people who were tracked as engaged with our marketing emails. We could see someone who clicked on a certain link twice, but when discussing in-person or over the phone, too often we would hear people make claims that they 'never received the email.' Call it lies on their part, but this happened more than several occasions which led us to doubt certain email results.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We attempted to use Act-On for marketing event planning. We would send email invitations to a mass list, and then follow up individually by phone to those who were flagged as email openers. Those who clicked were often informed on the contents of the email, so we would attempt to get these individuals to attend the event we were planning.

The landing page creator was hard to use, and the email tool made it so challenging create professional-looking emails, we ended up going back to our previous email platform to manage this.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On is a very easy to use tool for automation.  You can set from a single-mail campaign to a complex behaviour flux.   Use all capabilities connecting other tools and setting lead scoring to all actions.  It incudes the option to create landing pages and gated content, so you are always un control of your information.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Databases sometimes can get messy easily.  Segmentation is not the best feature (you need to create cascades to create segments).  Another feature should be optimized is the options in the landing pages editor (some options are very limited or simple, some HTML codes are not accepted).  Also the e-mail footers are kind of messy to admin when you're sending a unique e-mail.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Act-On is a powerful tool for mid-market requeriments.  You can set almost all parameters for leadscoring and connect many other tools, but if you are looking for complex DB connections or advanced marketing intelligence, you might look for another tool.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On and CAN-SPAM Act policies will not let you send e-mail to generic e-mails (contact@xxxxx, admin@xxxxx, help@xxxxx) so if your database contain many addreses like that you will not be able to track their activities.

all_reviews.review_title: User friendly platform with a surplus of support materials
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I chose this platform because it had the enterprise-level capability of marketing platforms like IBM, but it was much more user-friendly and cost-effective. Plus, the technical support we receive is almost always top-notch and very responsive.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
At the beginning of our relationship, they were extremely responsive. The account person who courted us really listened to our needs and was very helpful as I, a marketing user, was trying to navigate several technical concerns. Since then, they have unfortunately left the business so now I feel our support is standard, not expceptional.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Between Act-On and Hubspot, we chose Act-On based on price and team support. Our biggest concern was getting something that was a right fit for us and our clients. I think Hubspot would've been a very comparable choice, but it has a built-in CRM, where we have a separate CRM that Act-On can integrate with, and our clients would all have a separate CRM, too. Hubspot was also a little more expensive. When in doubt, do all the free trials!!!

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to more efficiently on-board marketing and sales uers than that of our previous platform. It helps us be more efficient in campaign building and deployment. And it's so user-friendly that non-technical users can get a lot accomplished on their own so our development teams can focus on other work.

They have formal partnerships with some other partners we use, like Healthgrades, which reduces the amount we have to develop or integrate.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Act On's workflow is cumbersome. It's not terribly intuitive to build drip campaigns, and the ease of building customized reports leaves a lot to be desired. One thing in particular that I haven't been impressed with is their list management functions. It's not easy to manage opt-ins and -outs, and move contacts between lists and so on.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
If you have the money for Act On, consider other products that are in the same tier - Hub Spot, Pardot, and Marketo are also very feature rich and have better UI/UX.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Act On for our outbound email marketing campaigns to customers and employees. It gets the job done and we don't experience a lot of errors of failures.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Program with Potential to round out Member Experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
First and foremost, I like the automated programs, which has allowed us to reduce the time and manual labor we put into building ad hoc emails. We've been able to push out information faster and able to reach more people than Constant Contact.
Second, I like scoring process. We can cookie the users, and set up different criteria of how they're scored. From that, we created a leads list for our contact center, so they can personally reach out.
Third, I love the segment feature we can create with a list in the contacts. That has allowed us to further divide out who's interested in our products and services after two emails, then better market to those users.
Lastly, I like Act-On University. This program is intimidating, but Uni has a selection of different courses you can take depending on how you want to use the software. We have a team of primary users, and also a sales team. Both have very different roles in how we use Act-On, so it's great to see our team on the same page.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The program itself is intimidating. There are so many factors that go into one email, that it takes a few months to fully grasp the concepts. Act-On University has really helped with that, so I'd recommend going through as many of the workshops as possible. The downside to that, is if you're looking to get certified and do the live workshops, the presenter has to manually upload your name for you to get credit. I reached out to support and it wasn't as helpful as I was hoping.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
This software has forms that we integrated with our website, so we have the ability to track our users and better grasp their behaviors and conversions. It's allowed us to create our own templates and use those for outbound and the automated programs. We've been able to provide our contact center with a list of hot leads, which we've gotten positive feed back from.

We use Act-On for email marketing, landing pages, and webinar automation. It's a good tool for all three of these.

The form building tool is easy to use with a great, recently updated interface that makes it fun to build and organize forms (it was a bit of a nightmare in the old version).

What do you dislike about Act-On?
We continue to have issues with emails not reaching people and being diverted to junk boxes or being blocked. We've engaged with Act-On in the past to try and improve this and saw some results, but not enough considering we paid them for the engagement.

Also, the Webex/Act-On integration can be glitch-y. We consistently have issues with panelists not being able to sign on the way they're meant to in the system and small mis-haps like that (which can be a big deal in a live webinar),

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have set up an email marketing program and an customer email engagement program in Act-On that have been very successful. The Salesforce integration is powerful and easy to use. Our Sales team uses Salesforce and our marketing team works a lot in Act-On, so it benefits both teams greatly.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On streamlines a lot of the features necessary for a marketing automation program, allowing marketers to intuitively build programs. Before Act-On, we were using one of the bulkier options on the market, and found we were paying too much for features we didn't understand or couldn't use. Act-On was a great help during our research phase, giving us full use cases, walking us through the product, and allowing us a demo environment so that we could get our bearings and be up and ready to go in a very short amount of time.

Building an automation program only takes a few minutes, and the email and landing page designers are easy to use and come out looking really nice, even if you're not a designer.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
EDIT: I've had a support ticket open for one month

Some of the back-end of the product can be a little confusing, which is then exacerbated by slow responses from the support team via the ticket system. There is a lot of setup necessary to get everything running smoothly, and with so many moving parts, tracking codes, lists and variables, it makes sense that there would be hiccups, but it can be frustrating waiting days for a response from support.

Additionally, the interface can be very slow when saving a program, adding a list, etc. Not a dealbreaker by any means, but something to be aware of.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Really run a few test programs out of the demo environment to get a feel for what you understand and what you don't. Their demos are flashy and they are quite knowledgable, but you won't know what you need to know unless you really try to build and run something.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Act-On we were able to find a marketing automation solution that allowed our very small team to spin up an engagement program in a very short amount of time without any of us having to be experts in the software. all_reviews.review_title: Good platform if you are not using Salesforce as your CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
It's a robust tool if you want to upgrade from a Vertical Response/MailChimp/Constant Contact email marketing tool but you aren't ready yet for a full on Marketing Automation Tool (ex: Pardot, Marketo). In addition to email marketing, the tool provides tracking, behavior scoring, deep database segmentation, lead nurturing programs, landing pages and forms.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The Salesforce integration is very poor. It is not a bidirectional sync which means Act-On will overwrite your good date with older one because it first pushes the data to SFDC and then pulls it back into Act-On. You can "accelerate" the syncing time to every 4 hours but chances are, your Sales Team and other SFDC integrations are updating this information every hours minimum. This also means that you cannot use Act-On to make changes to fields in SFDC (ex: status changes) IF SFDC is already making those changes.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I only recommend Act-On if you are not looking for any level of integration with Salesforce. If you are, I recommend going with more robust Marketing Automation tools that have a syncing of 2-4 minutes (very important). However, Act-On is a good step up to a basic email marketing tool (ex: Vertical Response, Constant Contact) as it does more than "send 1-many emails".

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email Marketing, Data capture (forms + landing pages), tracking and cooking.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
My company has been using Act-On for almost 3 years growing from a few dozens leads a month to hundreds. During this time I have tested almost all of Act-On functionality.
They offers very basic marketing automation capabilities: online forms, sending email, tracking known and anonymous visitors and lead score. Everythings else is only on paper and is not working well enough to provide value.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
1) Integration - #1 issue when growing with Act-on. Majority of tools do not offer integration with Act-On and even the few that do - it's not a native integration to forms, but to lists (due to type of APIs they are offering) which reduces your capabilities significantly and reduce efficiency. Even their native integration (GoToWebinar for example) are not perfect. They provide zero support and have provided us suggestions for workarounds that have only wasted our time and have not solve the issue.

2) My experience with Act-On has been painful from almost day one and mostly due to their horrible customer support. They keep moving you from one person to another. Customer success managers change every few months, usually without telling you. Their support 'engineers' proficiency is very low and availability of calls is usually one week.
3) Almost all features are half-baked from reporting to social media, automated programs, landing pages and many more. It seems like they just want to check a checkbox and not really provide value to their customers.
They solely rely on the understand the replacing a marketing automation system is a hard process which requires many resources.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Choose a different vendor

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
It offers basic marketing automation capabilities, but when choosing a marketing automation platform you need to remember that transition cost is high and you need to find a long-term solution. I highly doubt it Act-On can be the right fit for any company regardless of size and focus.

We are also better at targeting our leads and customizing our emails and landing pages accordingly in a matter of minutes. We are able to sync our marketing lists with CRM making us much more efficient and saving us lots of time when it comes to targeting, customizing and sending our marketing messages.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The platform integrates all your automation requirements along with an online support university (that's really useful) and great telephone support both in-country and from the USA. We have integrated Act-On with Salesforce, the support Act-On has given includes improving the integration and when we've had problems with Salesforce your CRM will also try and help with solutions - really rate the support offered!

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Sometimes the set-ups can be quite complex. The platform is also being modernised and this sometimes conflicts with our legacy set-ups. When Salesforce updates this can often affect the Act-on API.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Ensure you think about what you are trying to achieve - what does success look like... takes a while to set-up but well worth it if you have a clear marketing and customer contact strategy.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Taking communication from integrated to ambient with measures that allow the function of marketing and sales. Creating leads, measuring leads, converting to customer, creating life-long customer relationships. Also used to assist with automation in the sales team - making the customer contact process more transparent. Also being used as a customer experience improvement tool - providing mobile compliant pages (away from our main website - that are fully measured) to provide customers with a 24/7 place to go for workshop assistance (i.e. pre-reading). These pages are not indexed, so don't sit in search engines and visitor data is collected so that they can be removed from reminder emails (based on when they have interacted with the page). Work's really well!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I like how easy it is to use. From creating landing pages to forms to uploading and managing  your images, I would say it is very user friendly. It is easy for someone to pick up quickly. I can pass along a project to a summer intern and they can navigate and pick up the drag and drop system very easily.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
My only complaint about Act-On is I wish they had a better tech support network. Currently, they have a community based forum or you can email a staff member your question. Ideally, I would prefer to either have a designated tech support advisor to my business account or have the capability to chat with a tech support personnel online.

When I have a technical issue or complaint, the email system does not serve it right. For example, if I have an issue that cannot be resolved in a timely manner, the conversation gets lost in my inbox over time thus forcing me to manage the conversation and try to keep up with the topic all while I am working on other tasks.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I would recommend act-on if you do a lot of email marketing and you are looking to beef up your website without needing to hire an agency. An internal marketing employee can easily have a bigger presence with the help of act-on. This service offers more than just email marketing and can really give your business that professional look without the agency price.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it for landing pages for our website,  electronic forms for on-site conferences on an ipad, surveys for internal purposes, subscription email center, email marketing and contact management just to name a few. A big benefit is to be able to track all activity one contact does within our marketing from visiting our website to opening and clicking within our email blasts.

all_reviews.review_title: A Solid Choice for Marketing Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The list management system is easily the best part of Act-On.  The options and customization available to create, import, export, sync and segment your lists is phenomenal.   It really allows you to dig deep into your list data and run programs based on that data.  These features also really help in reporting as you can segment on actions taken by records and so forth.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The email builder and landing page builder are pretty meh.  Lots of counter-intuitive things like changes in templates do not affect the pages/emails built from that template.  Editing an email OUTSIDE of a program does not change the email in the program.  The forms stink.  Just awful.  For example, if you want a drop down of all 50 states in a select box, well, have fun typing out ALL 50 STATES AND THEIR RESPECTIVE VALUES!

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Hire an agency to help you get the most out of Act-On.  It's an expensive tool and there is no way you will utilize everything it can do for you without assistance.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are an agency that uses Act-On to manage client lead generation and email marketing.  It's a solid option for lead gen and nurture programs.  We have had a lot of success using Act-On with our clients.  Our clients that use SalesForce or MS Dynamics have the added bonus of integration.  We've been able to streamline many a sales process using these tools.

all_reviews.review_title: Functional software, easy to access support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The general marketing automation functions are mostly there (email and metrics, drip campaigns, some prospecting, landing pages, contact management, CRM connection, social media account management, etc.) and for the most part easy to use. Their support is great; whenever I have a question, I've gotten an answer within the day, and for the most part the issues are solved. Those that couldn't be solved by support were reported or bumped up to engineering (at least that's what I've been told) to look into as bugs or potential future enhancements. The biggest reason I signed with them in the first place (over Pardot and Marketo) was due to their responsiveness and personal touch.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
They changed their model from a monthly payment to an annual payment, which would have been fine, except then the sales person tried to upsell me with their extra data solution which ultimately did not work as promised, even though I confirmed multiple times what I wanted to do and was skeptical from the beginning that it could do what I wanted. There are certain aspects that still show that Act-On is a work in progress (such as sales users not being sent emails to create passwords to utilize the platform, instead needing to just use the "forgot password" function, or the still somewhat clunky form/landing page/email creation tools). I've also had 4 or 5 different account managers over 3 years, which suggests a lot of turnover/company structural changes, and it can get a little annoying, but fortunately their support line is always responsive.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Ultimately it comes to what tools you need and what you plan on actually using. Decide first what you are doing and where you want to be in 5 years, and then decide of this is the solution you want. Marketing automation is something you want to stick with and not move around from system to system, so once you are satisfied, be prepared to be using the system for the foreseeable future unless you have that much extra time and money to keep switching (in which case honestly you are probably not using it correctly or are not ready for marketing automation).

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have pulled many of our marketing efforts into one single source, including email, forms, content, and landing page management. The content management is particularly beneficial, as all links stay the same even when we update the content, meaning that all emails, forms, and the website are updated at once without people ending up with broken links.

If you already know what you want to do, they can help you do it.... but they are VERY tool driven. They cannot help you figure out what may be best for your market. Don't buy them before you've gotten everything figured out. We did and it was a constant state of "Catch-up." I got the feeling that we never did anything as fast or as well as their support folks would have liked.

Didnt integrate well with our CRM either.

Develop your vision BEFORE you begin. Get a graphics person on board with you too. You need more than marketing skills to get this off the ground.

They COULD have encouraged us to do some prep PRIOR to contracting.... then we may still be with them.
Not a bad company.... more than half the problems were ours, not theirs.... but they could have helped us figure things out better.

all_reviews.review_title: Save yourself the trouble and automate it
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-on is useful for marketing automation, mass emails, forms, and landing pages; it meets many of our needs along with Salesforce integration allowing us to operate much more efficiently with forms and emails as well as integrating dynamic content into our marketing.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
There needs to be more bulk editing capabilities. I spend a lot of time (sometimes entire days) making mass updates of the same exact change across all of our marketing emails, landing pages, and templates. We have many templates /automated+triggered emails / landing pages that share similar data / content blocks. It should be possible to save these content blocks and edit them in such a way that it will also update any templates / automated emails / triggered emails that have the content block embedded in them. I've been using custom variables as a workaround to sort of have this capability but it is limited. The content blocks proposed by Act-On (in the works) can be embedded in emails but will not globally update all automated / triggered / etc emails that have the content block in them if the content block is edited, making this upcoming feature close to useless for our needs.

Webinars should be something you can copy / duplicate the setup of. I spend a lot of time setting up individual webinars exactly the same way older webinars are set up with some minor differences Currently I have to re-set up the similar signup form, email reminders, marketing emails, and post-webinar emails for every webinar taking a lot of time when I have to do this for multiple webinars. Also the overall interface for this is clunky when I have to choose templates to base emails off of because I have to scroll through a massive dropdown of all of our email templates to find the ones I need for the webinar.

Previewing of custom fields and dynamic content needs to be easier. Currently I have set up many email addresses with different variable information and segmentations that allow me to preview dynamic content that look for those variables to display things differently, but this was overly convoluted to set up and requires privileges to actually send emails (because you need to apply the segmented list to the email to preview it) that only I have and some of our template designers don't have (and shouldn't have). Currently custom fields also don't preview properly unless actually composing the email to send and segmenting it as well.

It should be possible to further customize forms to accept variables based on what page they are on. As it stands I have to set up over 100 forms that are the exact same form just with 1 or 2 hidden variables changed based on the landing page I have the forms embedded on and there is no real way to work around this effectively (believe me I've tried) -- cookied information doesn't work reliably and neither does passing the variables on the URL through custom javascript.

Forms should also have the ability to have content block templates set up in such a way that changing the content block would also update any forms that it is used on. Currently I have to regularly update the same exact field on every single form (start semester) we have (think having to update 200+ forms with the same exact change, days worth of unnecessary mindless repetitive work that could easily be bulkified / an instantaneous single global change)

Act-on's web interface has memory leaks, user interface bugs, and the overall interface is slow and clunky compared to modern web apps. I have to run Act-on in a separate web browser and after using it for a while to make changes (particularly editing landing pages) it will slow down the web browser to the point where it will freeze for several seconds on making edits. I'll need to completely shut down the browser and restart it which frees up the memory resources of the browser clearing the memory leaks and allowing me to work with Act-On again. This is a bug we've noticed across all of our users who work with Act-On. I've had to instruct everyone who uses Act-On to open it in a separate web browser and when it begins getting slow to completely exit the web browser and open it again. The memory leaks at least should be investigated and remedied, but the overall interface could use many enhancements to make it more in-line with modern web applications.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
It's a very useful tool for marketing automation, forms, and landing pages.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've integrated forms with Salesforce allowing us to better keep track of and service our prospects and clients.

We utilize segmentation to send emails to the appropriate people and we use dynamic content to make sure everyone gets the information they need.

We use automated programs to complete tasks automatically rather than having them be tasks manually completed by our team saving a lot of work and making the team more efficient.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Act-On?
review_question_answers.answer: Act-on is useful for marketing automation, mass emails, forms, and landing pages; it meets many of our needs along with Salesforce integration allowing us to operate much more efficiently with forms and emails as well as integrating dynamic content into our marketing.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Act-On?
review_question_answers.answer:
There needs to be more bulk editing capabilities. I spend a lot of time (sometimes entire days) making mass updates of the same exact change across all of our marketing emails, landing pages, and templates. We have many templates /automated+triggered emails / landing pages that share similar data / content blocks. It should be possible to save these content blocks and edit them in such a way that it will also update any templates / automated emails / triggered emails that have the content block embedded in them. I've been using custom variables as a workaround to sort of have this capability but it is limited. The content blocks proposed by Act-On (in the works) can be embedded in emails but will not globally update all automated / triggered / etc emails that have the content block in them if the content block is edited, making this upcoming feature close to useless for our needs.

Webinars should be something you can copy / duplicate the setup of. I spend a lot of time setting up individual webinars exactly the same way older webinars are set up with some minor differences Currently I have to re-set up the similar signup form, email reminders, marketing emails, and post-webinar emails for every webinar taking a lot of time when I have to do this for multiple webinars. Also the overall interface for this is clunky when I have to choose templates to base emails off of because I have to scroll through a massive dropdown of all of our email templates to find the ones I need for the webinar.

Previewing of custom fields and dynamic content needs to be easier. Currently I have set up many email addresses with different variable information and segmentations that allow me to preview dynamic content that look for those variables to display things differently, but this was overly convoluted to set up and requires privileges to actually send emails (because you need to apply the segmented list to the email to preview it) that only I have and some of our template designers don't have (and shouldn't have). Currently custom fields also don't preview properly unless actually composing the email to send and segmenting it as well.

It should be possible to further customize forms to accept variables based on what page they are on. As it stands I have to set up over 100 forms that are the exact same form just with 1 or 2 hidden variables changed based on the landing page I have the forms embedded on and there is no real way to work around this effectively (believe me I've tried) -- cookied information doesn't work reliably and neither does passing the variables on the URL through custom javascript.

Forms should also have the ability to have content block templates set up in such a way that changing the content block would also update any forms that it is used on. Currently I have to regularly update the same exact field on every single form (start semester) we have (think having to update 200+ forms with the same exact change, days worth of unnecessary mindless repetitive work that could easily be bulkified / an instantaneous single global change)

Act-on's web interface has memory leaks, user interface bugs, and the overall interface is slow and clunky compared to modern web apps. I have to run Act-on in a separate web browser and after using it for a while to make changes (particularly editing landing pages) it will slow down the web browser to the point where it will freeze for several seconds on making edits. I'll need to completely shut down the browser and restart it which frees up the memory resources of the browser clearing the memory leaks and allowing me to work with Act-On again. This is a bug we've noticed across all of our users who work with Act-On. I've had to instruct everyone who uses Act-On to open it in a separate web browser and when it begins getting slow to completely exit the web browser and open it again. The memory leaks at least should be investigated and remedied, but the overall interface could use many enhancements to make it more in-line with modern web applications.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
review_question_answers.answer: It's a very useful tool for marketing automation, forms, and landing pages.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
We've integrated forms with Salesforce allowing us to better keep track of and service our prospects and clients.

We utilize segmentation to send emails to the appropriate people and we use dynamic content to make sure everyone gets the information they need.

We use automated programs to complete tasks automatically rather than having them be tasks manually completed by our team saving a lot of work and making the team more efficient.

all_reviews.review_title: Former Act-On User, Moved to other Marketing Automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On is very inexpensive and relatively easy to use.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Extremely high turnover of client facing personnel.  in the 2 years we used the application, we had no less than 5 sales/CSM personnel work our account, as people were constantly leaving the company. The user interface was very basic and felt cheap, which was a review I saw before selecting Act-On, but became more apparent when looking at other options after our negative customer experience.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Really consider what you value.  Act-On lists pricing very similar to other Marketing Automation softwares, but they will offer deep discounting to get your business.  When we emailed the same prospects in Act-On and Pardot we had much different delivery rates, so the reputation of Act-On's IP addresses was suspect.  They may have improved that, but it is definitely a point to ask about.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were able to track and engage customers with emails, website and social media content and aggregate that into a single engagement view of the customer.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On is a robust, yet easy-to-use solution that combines multiple marketing applications into one.  It has been a workhorse for us.  While it can serve more than a dozen vital functions, including social media management and ABM, I most appreciate its integration with our CRM system (Microsoft Dynamics 365) and how it can be used to automate nurture programs, score leads based on behavior/engagement, and monitor web site visitor activity.  I'm also very impressed by members of the tech support team who are very patient and have bailed us out of an after hours pinch more than once.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Keeping up with the constant evolution of Act-On is a full-time job. I often feel like we're 5 steps behind in understanding newly released features and everything it can do.  Of course, that's a good problem.  My only true critique is that the organization seems to have gone through some growing pains and lost its personal touch along the way.  When I first selected and implemented Act-On at my previous company 4 years ago, I felt like our sales rep and implementation team were truly invested in our success. I was so impressed by the product and Act-On's customer success team that I implemented it again at my next company and recommended it to several peers.  However, faces began to change quickly, and we had 3 different reps in the same year. Our new contacts were less interested in our success and more interested in what we could do for them.  One became obsessed with recruiting our company as a reseller. Things have settled down, but I don't feel like they value our business as much as they once did.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On gives us much greater visibility into the performance of our campaigns and executing campaigns, especially email nurture programs, is far easier. Now we know who is engaging with our content and who is not, which allows us to more effectively focus our time and effort.  Also, since all our web forms are powered by Act-On, leads go directly into our CRM which has eliminated manual data entry.

all_reviews.review_title: Rising Star in the Marketing Automation World
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On has a lot going on and seems to be improving rapidly. The wysiwyg editor is probably the best of any platform that I've used, the list management and automation workflow structures are easy to use and understand.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The reporting functions at the moment aren't great. The team seems to be improving functionality of these but at the moment the graphics used in charts and such... just aren't that great.
Some of the user interface doesn't make sense - some reports being in the report link and others being in the Outbound messages section.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Make sure you work with their team to ensure things are set up properly. We forgot to ensure that all of our messages ended up in Campaigns when we sent them. This made for lots of clean up work after the fact.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've used Act-On to step up our marketing automation - when someone makes a donation through our website Act-On now runs them through a series of automated drip marketing series depending on their location and donation amount.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The way this product is organized, how the workflows and editors work, all make Act-On a solid contender in the Marketing Automation space.  I especially like how easy it is to create pages and emails - most MA software really requires an HTML CSS specialist to do things right, not with Act-On.

Now this said, weaker areas are the way the editors aren't yet fully WYSIWIG yet, how the test email function works (confusingly), the mix of browser default notifications and software notifications, and how your work is organized all add up to a fairly lumpy, if functional UX.

Which would be excuseable if their support didn't suck.  All support is through tickets - no hot/in-app support and the help base is very weak at best.

In the comparison among the big dogs in the space, Act-On is a decent value any they are relatively negotiable on price.  I paid just over half list price for our install.  NEVER buy at list!  (hint: buy software the last week of a quarter.  Their reps are in serious dialing for dollars mode then and deep discounts can be had).  But shop hard and think about what can be the best fit for your business.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Lack of good support. Is the bissgest disappointment we had with Act-On.  The product is a solid competitor to Hubspot, Pardot, Marketo, etc but they need to provide better support.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Shop them hard and don't buy at list.  Get them to upgrade their support in your contract to dedicated account managers.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead gen nurturing and inbound marketing.

all_reviews.review_title: Terrible company to work with if you're a small/medium business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Nothing at all. System has terrible UX, difficult to navigate, and their business practices and billing are poor to say the least.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Read the contract carefully. They include an auto-renewal clause that is non-cancelable. They will not notify you at all when the contract renewal is coming up and automatically lock you into a full year which they won't let you cancel. As a small business testing out systems this is horrible. They should at least notify customers of upcoming renewals. We had stopped using the software as months before and forgot about it until we starting seeing $3k charges to the company. When we tried to cancel they refused and sent the account to a collection agency...well done Act-on. Any world class software company doesn't try to trick clients into sticking with them. Provide a valuable service and clients will gladly stick with you.....when Adobe, Microsoft, and Google all allow you to adjust subscriptions and drop subscriptions to services not being used at any time.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Look at other solutions that don't do auto-renewal without notification and lock you into annual subscriptions.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
No benefits at all. Spent thousands of dollars, a ton of hours, and saw no effect on the business.  Their tracking of website visits tells you very little...99% will be ISP providers...great ATT, comcast, Turner came to the site...
