all_reviews.review_title: Very good and solid marketing automation system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
As with any other marketing automation system, the principles are the same - you want to automate journeys for your customers and prospects. I find it extremely important that it is easy to set up these journeys and easy to navigate around the system. When you work in marketing it is a fast paced environment, so you need an intuitive system - Act-On very much offers this. From my experience working with the system, the navigation is super easy and the automated customer journeys are easy to set up and looks very good from a visual point of view. But it's not all about the journeys, Act-On offer so much more than that.Setting up web forms and landing pages for your website is extremely easy. Another thing I find great about the system is the very simple CRM integration. The Act-On academy or University offer some great help via useful articles, so even very junior people can set up the connection with CRM systems such as Salesforce or Microsoft Dynamics. If you are in the beginning of exploring marketing automation and you are working on a pretty low scale database I think you should definitely go for Act-On, you can get a really good insight in to the world of marketing automation and you can learn a lot from the system which also very reasonably priced.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
This is definitely a great system. For my use I need it to connect with Salesforce CRM, and when I set up the customer journeys and wanted to add completion actions to behavior, it became apparent that sending the lead to Salesforce and creating tasks at the same time wasn't as straight forward as with Salesforce won marketing automation technologies. However, I very quickly worked around that issue and managed to get to the same outcome.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Definitely go for it if you're new to marketing automation and want to achieve great things immediately.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automating marketign processes and connecting with Salesforce CRM.

I wish it were more intuitive - you know what I want to do, stop making me jump through hoops to do it!

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Get in there and get dirty. Push a lot of buttons, make a lot of forms, create a ton of surveys, save a lot of drafts. This is a simpler version of the many marketing automation tools out there, but for a small team like mine, it's a perfect fit. We're not running 12-month long drip email programs or anything like that, so driving a school bus when all I need is a sedan is silly.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
ZERO digital presence. Our target audience isn't very digitally inclined, so it's not like we're being left in dust, but this makes me look like a rockstar because I'm able to engage an audience that we had nothing but phone calls and direct mail relationships with in the past.

all_reviews.review_title: A straightforward but rich solution to marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
It works  'out of the box'  which is a rarity in Marketing Automation. It's very easy to integrate with Salesforce and so creates a continuum to build acquisition and retention programmes keeping marketing and sales aligned in their views across the customer journey. And now it's bringing in ABM features to complete the approach.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
There are a few interface issues which are normally easy to resolve and there are a few parts of the product which are a little primitive - eg the forms builder, but Act-on is good at launching new features and gets better with every release.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
As with any MA system, think about what you're trying to achieve first and develop your strategy rather than just letting the system think for you. I'd say that Act-On is ideal if you are a firm where data is important, measurement is key, and ease of use is vital, eg for smaller marketing teams where everyone needs to be hands on. It's not the all-encompassing big MA, but many businesses will buy large scale MA and use it like Mailchimp (no monkey offence intended). Act-on makes it easy to make MA real in your business and actually have it work to support your customer acquisition and retention programmes.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We wanted a straightforward solution to start our lead generation programmes that would bring in the richness of marketing automation without the long set-up and implementation times. Act-on is usable out of the box and has allowed us to organise our programmes effectively for both marketing and sales and delivering these programmes far more rapidly than if we'd gone down other routes.

I've been a long-time Act-on customer and have always been pleased with the decision many years ago to select Acton as our marketing automation solution. Although I love the technology they have in place, and really love the low total cost of ownership, I'd have to say that hands-down I'm most impressed, excited about, and thankful for the superb employees at Acton. Every individual I have interacted with, from Sales, to Support, to Professional Services, and Customer Success are the absolute best at what they do. No matter what, the entire company is dedicated to one thing -- making sure their customers are enthusiastically happy and wildly successful with their automation implementation. Each step of the way in our automation journey, the Acton team has made it so convenient, easy and enjoyable to uncover all the golden nuggets of success along our journey :-)

I like that it was fairly easy to create each email template and send them out. I also liked how easy it was to get to the statistics of each email. Lastly, I liked how you could schedule an email to be sent out easily and could test emails easily as well.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I don't like how you can only have a certain amount of dynamic lists connected to Microsoft Dynamics CRM because it takes a lot of time to update each of the other lists. I wish there was a way to get more dynamic lists. I also wish you could've edited the way that Act-On collected statistics on each email. I don't want to know the percentage of how many people clicked on the email compared to everyone who received it. I would rather see a percentage of how many people clicked on the email compared to everyone who opened it. If you could put in your own criteria for the statistics you want to see, it would be more helpful.

What do you like best about Act-On?
Our company spent about 2 months seriously evaluating the top 6 marketing automating tools. To be perfectly honest, they all do about the same thing but we initially ruled out Silverpop, Eloqua and Hubspot based first off of price but also not loving the ease of use or interface. This left Marketo, Pardot and Act-On, which are all great tools. One of the things that set Act-On apart for us was that it was least expensive of the bunch but was also our favorite with the ease of use. It's very intuitive. It's integrates very well with Salesforce. We felt it would have the best chance for adoption with our sales reps. They've found it very helpful having both the high level engagement (the aggregated lead score) and the more detailed view of activity history with each lead in Salesforce. The email tool is powerful. On the They are very deep in features and constantly making updates/new additions. Their support team is superb; probably one of the best I've ever dealt with. I've never had to wait to speak to someone and they are very knowledgeable in their own product.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Our dislikes are fairly minor. Their forms aren't the prettiest out of the box. Because of this, we've been using Gravity forms as a plug in with our word press theme, which then integrates with Act-On. They've since make changes for more customization but it still doesn't quite work the way we want (using our existing website header and footer). The "hot prospects" list (those who recently increased their lead score) takes a long time to load and isn't always indicative of who our potential customers are. Part of making this more useful lies with the lead qualifying on our end but it would be nice to have a way to filter non-relevant leads based on job title (such as consultants or students).

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
It's a great tool. There are less expensive options out their so I would look into those and make sure your company has a large enough database in terms of the number of leads to really get your money out of the investment.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Interacting with potential clients, monitoring those who are engaging with our content and instigating programs to help facilitate conversations and sales.

Act-On does pretty much everything you expect a Marketing Automation Tool to do, but their support is the best! all_reviews.review_title: As a client side Marketing Executive that predominantly focuses on digital
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I need tools that can support my role by delivering accuracy, ease of use, insight and automation. I can confidently state that Act-on ticks all of these boxes, as well as a whole lot more.

I've been using the software fairly regularly for about 6 months. I must admit that I found the platform pretty daunting to begin with (due to the sheer amount of available options), but once I'd got going I quickly learnt that the interface was easy to understand, simple to use and created with me (the user) in mind.

I can easily design and schedule email campaigns, create segments from our CRM (Salesforce), build bespoke landing pages without a degree in HTML (drag and drop), view visitors to our website, generate reports on a variety of marketing activities, A/B test website content...the list goes on and on, and to be honest I barely feel like I've scratched the surface.

Our Act-on Account Manager Scott Wallace has an incredible wealth of product knowledge and has always been quick to answer questions and provide additional support (remote sessions) as and when required. Ad-hoc technical support has also been fast, accurate and helpful.

I also receive regular updates about new functionality as well as invites to webinars too.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I only wish that some of these webinars were held in the UK (rather than the US), so that the timings were a bit more suited to my hours, though to be fair they are accessible as videos after the event.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
In summary, I would happily recommend Act-on to any marketing professionals who are looking to delve deeper into email automation, insight into target audiences and online improvements.

I use Act-On for our marketing automation platform. I primarily use it for sending email campaigns, inbound lead generation through the use of Act-On forms, and to track website prospectors. I code emails in Dreamweaver, paste the code into Act-On through their Outbound messages, and love that I can track opens, clicks, and engagement with my emails. I also like that I can then also segment lists based on demographics, geographics, and psychographics using Act-On's behavior segments. Finally, I enjoy that the Act-On forms are easy to navigate and can easily be incorporated into our website.

I wish that there was a better way to manage subscription preferences. Act-On is set up to allow users to manage subscription preferences through Act-On only. The subscription management platform is great; however, our company is therefore not able to change any preferences in CRM, which creates some issues. Multiple clients call us about their subscription preferences and request we change them for them instead of them changing them through Act-On's opt-out link and subscription management platform. We're therefore unable to do this for them.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Act-On is easy to navigate and still offers quite a bit of features comparable to HubSpot, Marketo, and other leading marketing automation platforms. The support team is fantastic.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're currently working through a potential solution to the subscription management preferences issue mentioned above.

There are so many inbound lead generation and analyzing benefits available in Act-On that we are just tapping in to. The website prospector tool is so handy and I also enjoy simply searching for a user based on email address to track activity on our site, with forms, and with email campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: ACT-ON should be use by anyone who wants to increase email ROI by over 300%
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I am a huge fan of the most recent dashboard. It makes it really easy for my users to navigate through and pull the required information from the tools ACT-ON has to offer.

As for the features, my team and I really enjoy the segmentation and A/B splitting functionality. It is crucial for us since we have a worldwide market with different time zones and different peak times to send email marketing campaigns. Segmentation makes our jobs easier, especially when ACT-ON allows us to set scheduled sends based on different time zones and select markets.

The other main feature we truly enjoy is the aggregated analytics you get when you combine campaigns. This makes reporting on a weekly, monthly and yearly basis extremely fast.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I like pretty much all the features but there are times that the internal ACT-ON dev team appears to be conducting internal a/b testing of the dashboard. This can often make it confusing for my users when navigating through the dashboard as the interface will shift between one version to another.


Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
ACT-ON is worth every penny of your marketing budget. Try a demo and see for yourself.

We use ACT-ON as a way to engage and re-engage our client base with up-to-date flight deals and packages.

ACT-ON allowed us to to segment and market to very niche clients through its hyper segment features.

all_reviews.review_title: Agency user - brings strategy to new business - great product - excellent support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On brings a strategy to our new business generation that was simply lacking the level of depth before. It helps us to streamline the follow up efforts and build a revenue pipeline for the agency. In addition, we would like to be able to offer a marketing automation service to clients and the Apex model will enable us to do just that. All in all, a powerful suite of tools with excellent support on hand to guide the process.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
We have been using Act-On now for a year+. There is a lot to learn and we are yet to see ROI. However, I should add that we do expect to see ROI from it soon and any question over ROI should be considered not as a reflection of the system itself, but the-not-inconsiderable efforts it takes to switch to an inbound marketing strategy.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Don't under-estimate the efforts needed to switch to an inbound marketing strategy. Select a partner that is going to really offer close help and guidance - you will appreciate it. It has taken longer to implement, execute and scale than we first imagined. This was in part due to our existing IT set up which needed upgrading; the learning of the new system which is pretty in depth and won't be mastered overnight (Act-On's university is excellent); and developing the right content strategy. But the Act-On team is great and will go out of their way to help you get there.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are reducing the (wasted) time spent on chasing UNqualified new business. In other words, as this is about new business generation and getting more visibility on the engagement with the content we produce, we need to know what works and what does not. Act-On tells us that. We therefore have a more targeted list of BOFU leads to follow up. We do feel we have more control over our new business efforts and next year really hope to be able to scale these efforts.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use and very friendly team
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-on is easy to use and does what it says on the tin. It's not over-complicated like other marketing automation tools. And the support team are really quick to respond which is great!

What do you dislike about Act-On?
It can be slightly disjointed between A/B tests and regular emails. An A/B test doesn't appear in the sent emails so when reviewing email results, it means having to go into the two separate windows which proves difficult when trying to build a report on campaign results in chronological order.
We're also finding that emails are recording clicks inaccurately which is having an impact on our figures. It seems to recognise a mobile opening an email and downloading the content as a click.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I would recommend ensuring that Act-on integrates with your CRM if that's where you would like to manage your leads. If that's not essential for you then Act-on is a great tool to track the journey your audience go on from visiting your website to clicking on you emails and submitting a form. I would definitely suggest you arrange training for your sales team to make sure they have the right approach when making calls to your web visitors and email clickers.,

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's much easier to see where our leads are coming from, which activities are working well and which aren't. We're learning more from our campaigns and able to deliver warmer leads to our sales team.
The sales team find it easier to open conversations with leads and they like that they can send an email directly from CRM. It's easier to set a campaign up and the email creation is simple and easy to use.

all_reviews.review_title: Holistic Marketing Automation package for small businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On is rather unique in relation to many of its competitors, in that it makes marketing automation available to smaller businesses. While it still works well for large organisations, its strength to me lies in an easy to set up platform that can be navigated by newcomers to the marketing automation game. This strength becomes apparent when, like me, you get to compare it to other, more complex systems on a daily basis.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Its low bar for accessibility unfortunately also means that Act-On sometimes has less fleshed out features than you'd expect. Some things are counterintuitive or lack functionality where you'd expect or hope it to be. But I suppose that is what makes the platform accessible to small businesses. Fortunately none of these absent features are dealbreakers for a marketing automation platform, and are mostly nice-to-haves.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Its strength is its availability for SME level businesses. That is at once also its weakness. It has to come from somewhere, so some nice-to-have features are absent. It is however a great tool for companies just getting their feet wet in Marketing automation.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On helps me overcome the challenge that many of our clients have of not knowing what their website visitors, email respondents, form fillers are doing on their website. Being presented with this knowledge allows my clients to act on ( ;-) ) the behaviour of their prospects in near real-time, providing them insight into the right time to call and thus increasing revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: The most scalable marketing automation tool I've ever worked with
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
For me, Act-On's greatest single asset is  not actually one of its features, although there are many of those that are excellent and highly valuable to both me as a marketer and my organization as a whole. What really stood out for me initially, however, was the way their pricing model scales. By focusing on the mid-sized enterprises, their pricing model enables almost any business to get on board and start working with a fully fledged automation tool quickly at a level that suits their business. Act-on gives all users access to a great wealth of functionality, so smaller business can use the tools that larger business are looking for in other tools, but allows them to scale up their involvement level at their own pace.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
There's not much I actively dislike in the product. Of course, there is room for improvement but I get the feeling that Act-On actually listens to what we, the customers, are requesting.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I'd heartily recommend Act-On to any marketer. I've used some of the larger, more well known systems in previous roles and Act-On competes very well against them as far as features go but it's pricing model makes it a much easier sell internally and much more flexible. You don't need to outlay a large amount, which you can find difficult to justify initially. Instead, simply select the entry point you're comfortable with, build up your ROI and then expand as and when needed. It's a great tool that only seems to be improving. I couldn't rcommend it more.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
I needed to build up a complete marketing department within our company, almost from scratch and with limited resources. I was looking to professionalise all aspects of our Marketing strategy, from PR and branding to lead generation and nurturing activities and more. Also, I wanted to get a precise indication of who our audience are, what they're interested in and what their behaviour is, in relation to our business and what we do for them. Act-On enables me to address many of those issues through a single platform. It's helpful sales-focused functionality has also enabled me to build a much stronger link and interaction between sales and marketing within our organization. Within a year, we've been able to address a number of our most critical issues, triple our audience size, get a greater insight into our prospects/customers and make inroads into implementing many of the aspects outlined in our marketing and content strategy.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool to make your Marketing team more data-driven
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On is a "one stop shop" for gaining insight, measuring and optimizing Marketing efforts. The platform allows us to do anything from lead tracking, email automation, webinar planning to marketing analytics with just one tool. One of my favorite features is the integration of forms and website tracking, that allow me to gain more visibility into our users and their behavior. We use it also to track the performance of our individual inbound channels and website collateral. The big advantage of Act-On is how easy it is to set it up with other 3rd-party platforms such as Ms Dynamics or Google AdWords.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
It would be great to provide a more powerful and automated data export options. Right now reports can be only exported manually and it's not possible to schedule them or fully integrate them with our internal business intelligence dashboard. I would like to also get a bit more flexibility with the email templates - I still think there is a potential room for improvement in terms of responsiveness as well as the diversity of components.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Take an advantage of their free trial, dedicated support and online documentation/training. The dedicated support is especially helpful at the beginning, when you are getting familiar with the platform.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On allowed our team to become more data-driven and manage our Marketing activities better. With the tool we have also improved the cooperation and alignment across Sales and Marketing departments. The platform is robust enough to still give us a lot of potential for additional improvements going forward.

all_reviews.review_title: Accessible Email Marketing for All Levels
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On's email marketing platform offers a lot of great features and a huge variety of options, which is great. But the stellar product aside, the part I like best is the team at Act-On. I get a call every month from my sales rep, Jeff, and account manager, Eric, to make sure everything is going well, to answer questions, and to see if there are any questions I need answered. I usually don't, but it's nice of them to take this proactive approach to keeping their customers happy. I've used this platform at two companies now, and it has always been accessible and user-friendly.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I guess the only part I really dislike is the fact that there are so many features, I don't usually use them all. I'm sure they would benefit me, but I stick to what I need, get the job done, and get out.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Act-On is definitely one of the higher-end email automation platforms on the market, but for a good reason. If you are considering making the investment, make sure you know what you need out of your email platform. Act-On is great for sending high volume emails to a large group of customers and prospects. Whereas some other top companies count each email you send against your monthly allowance, Act-On counts your active contact count, and you can send as many times as you want in a month. This is helpful for a company like ours that sends weekly marketing emails to the same group for a month at a time. Besides that, Act-On allows you to take marketing into your own hands, creating forms, landing pages, and email automation so you can set it and forget it.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before I started using Act-On, I didn't really have experience with creating emails from scratch. Though the platform offers templates, which I do use, I can also easily craft my own templates and HTML features within the email composer.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The best part about Act-On (for our company at least) is probably the Salesforce integration. I'm able to accomplish everything that I need to accomplish seamlessly between Act-On and Salesforce. Our use of Act-On is probably fairly unique but every question or issue I throw at my Customer Success Manager (Scott S., who is AMAZING) is always met with a convenient and innovative solution.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
My biggest complaint so far is probably with Website Prospector. I've used other tools that are far more sophisticated in matching visitors with companies (instead of ISPs, which Prospector does more often than not) and in preserving a visitor's identity throughout their entire process (such as, linking an identity to an anonymous user once that user is identified via a form). I think it is probably heading in the right direction but at this point I think it's the feature that needs the most attention. I'm also not super wow'd by the e-mail templating system - templates are based on "stationary", which is far more difficult to manage than just allowing us to create HTML/WYSIWYG templates.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our previous marketing automation program operated mostly separately from our CRM, linking in only when it's information was dumped into the queue for our sales representatives to work. With Act-On, the opportunity for two-way syncing with Salesforce allows us to automate our marketing processes and escalate to Salesforce seamlessly, while then sending information back to Act-On as those prospects are worked. Act-On has been integral to connecting our marketing and sales efforts and automating our nurturing process throughout the lead life cycle.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The onboarding process. I had personal attention from my CSM and access to a "bat line" that I could call anytime I needed a quick answer. I've never had such a pleasant experience learning new software as I did with Act-On. I felt incredibly supported!
The software itself is intuitive, simple, and easy to use. Every time I think of a feature I wish it had, I do a quick search in the help (aka Act-On University, which is incredible), and turns out, it DOES do that! I have been delighted over and over again.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
It is a learning curve, but I would expect that with any new software. I wish there was a slightly faster way to onboard if, like us, you needed to be up and running really quickly.

Wish we'd known that up front and could have saved the hassle of a new contract!

We were using an antiquated CRM to do email marketing, and struggling with list management, segmentation challenges, no A/B testing capability, and horrible WYSIWYG editors. Act-On solved these problems and more, and we've been delighted. It also addressed our major issue of needing subscription preferences that could be managed by the customer... up to this point they could either universally opt out or opt in, but they couldn't take control of their own subscriptions. Act-On has that capability standard and you can customize it like crazy.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
I have a lot of favorite things about Act-On. Here are at least a few in no particular order:
Ease of Use - this tool can help a marketing team accomplish an astronomical amount of initiatives, whether small or large (I've worked with it for both) because it's easy to setup.  Within one month I was able to setup multiple automated programs.
Customer Support - I feel like they are my friends.  I talk to them often, not because of issues but because I ask a lot of questions and they are always there to help right away.
Customization - the tool may seem basic at first glance, however you can customize so many different areas to work exactly how you need it to for your business.  They don't try to mold you into specific things, they work right into your marketing landscape.
Innovation - I've been using Act On for over 5 years now. I've seen it grow. I've seen my feature suggestions get implemented, and not long after they are asked.  The tool is constantly evolving and product management truly listens to their customers on new features.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The one thing that we would really like to see within the tool is better tracking on forms behind the scenes as far as first source and last source directly from their cookie that they set. We had to create our own to truly capture this information.
Google Adwords - their report is great, however there are limitations. It only shows people clicking through ads that are visiting your website for the first time and submit a form during that session.  This needs to be expanded to accommodate for attribution models that may consider someone a conversion if they come back within 90 days, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent tool.  Has been a tremendous "force multiplier" for our electronic marketing efforts
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The two most powerful features for our use are list management and formatting the communications.  We don't use a CRM, but the list segmentation tool, if properly maintained, can in effect be used as a CRM.  The ability to segment is quite powerful as well.

In terms of formatting, Act-On provides a very simple-to-use graphical interface.  As I'd never used on at all, the learning curve was about a day for me.  For those more familiar, probably just a few hours.

One last thing:  the support, in terms of getting users up to speed, is OUTSTANDING.  They conduct regular training sessions via web conference, during which they address any questions or issues you have.

Act-On has many more advanced tools that, quite frankly, I don't make use of.  There is a lot of "campaign management" stuff that's more involved than what I need.  Also lots of automation - some of which I use, but most of which are beyond my requirements.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Two quibbles:

1) This isn't a factor when using the application, but when doing things like searching "Act-On University" or updating a user profile, you can't really use Internet Explorer.  I spend about a half-hour trying to pay an invoice, ultimately calling their customer service line, only to learn I can't pay through IE!  Seems odd that a software-based high tech company doesn't fully support the most popular browser on the market.

2)  When sending email blast, you must send to an entire segment OR to selected individuals.  You can't combine both.  This is quite annoying as I often want to send a communication to a list segment and maybe a half-dozen others.  As it's set up now, I have to send two separate emails....they really need to fix this.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
If you're looking for a simple to use, but powerful way to manage your electronic communications, there's a very good chance Act-On fills the bill.  My needs may not be as complex as most....but there's nothing I need to do that it really can't handle.  I've got forms on my site that customers can complete.  I get notifications, they get added to my lists, they get acknowledgement emails....it works very smoothly.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
The need to get regular, professional-looking and targeted communications to my customers and channel partners.  Act-On has done this very well.

all_reviews.review_title: Extremely poor service, switched to HubSpot
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Honestly not much. Almost every interaction we had with them was pretty poor. I suppose the fact that it's less expensive than Marketo is a bonus.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The user interface - difficult and complicated, poorly designed. The performance - very slow to load. The support - they stonewalled us when we asked them to address some issues.

In more details, we used Act-On for about a year, and saw a variety of problems. Here are some of them:

Downtime and unavailability. My customers/visitors repeatedly and publicly complained about not getting downloads they signed up for. After clicking through a form and filling out their information, instead of downloading an ebook they'd get a 404 not found error on Act-On's servers. Act-On denied that this could possibly happen and refused to even investigate it seriously. I found it unconscionable that they would blame us or just close support tickets without even trying to do something simple like look at server logs. Meanwhile I was getting a black eye on social media, and it's a lose lose situation because if you say "I'm trying to fix this problem but my vendor's systems are broken" you look even worse, so I ended up just emailing a bunch of PDFs to people personally who were trying to download but could not. This was not an isolated incident, it happened over the space of months and months.

Integration with SalesForce. Instead of really integrating with SalesForce, they keep a "walled garden" around the data and link to a page within Act-On. So in SalesForce, when you're looking at activity history for example and you see an email or something, you click into it and it's just a link to a page within Act-On. This means we're going to lose all of our historical data if we leave Act-On.

Performance of the product. We hosted our own website and embedded their JavaScript tracking snippets and forms. This was a nightmare. We repeatedly measured the performance impact that this had on our website's page load time for visitors and proved that the performance of loading their JavaScript was abysmal. It was causing issues such as Google Webmaster flagging our pages as slow (and as you know, this causes a hit to Page Rank, impacts SEO, and impacts the cost and visibility of Adwords and related ads.)

Security of the product. My engineers were horrified at the quality of the Act-On code. They warned me repeatedly that by embedding Act-On's snippets and forms into our pages, we were exposing our customers and visitors to genuinely insecure code. IN addition, the quality of their externally visible code was so low it gave us no confidence that their backend systems are secure or high quality.

Integration headaches. Everything was a spaghetti mess of broken HTML and styling. It was enough to make your eyes bleed trying to work with it.

Customer success. They basically abandoned and ignored us after we onboarded. Certainly did not follow their own best practices of customer success in the ebooks they constantly produced and marketed to me.

In summary, I think Act-On is a cheap knock-off of Marketo whose business model is "churn and burn." It's a sales-first product and company that doesn't deliver on promises and doesn't care.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Use HubSpot instead.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
The usual marketing automation things - email campaigns, forms and registration for downloads, lead scoring, etc.

From a lead generation and demand generation ROI perspective their pricing is absolutely worth the investment.

If you are evaluating marketing automation solutions I encourage you to test at least 3 different solutions before making a final decision.  Marketo, Pardot/ExactTarget, Eloqua, Hubspot, Act-On, etc are all solid tool sets.  Each have their own areas of excellence that match your marketing spend, business goals, and available internal resources differently.  I encourage anyone to bring business line heads/stakeholders, customer experience advocates, sales, marketing, and IT into the decision process if you are able.  If you are a small/medium business, limited on internal resources, budget sensitive, and are looking to take your cx/lead/demand generation programs to the next level absolutely include Act-On in your marketing automation evaluation process.

Improving customer experience and lead/demand generation efforts.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The new interface is very easy to use, combining email automation, web prospect information, landing page creation and social media usage all within one platform, unlike many other platforms which have some but not all features included. The new email editor is great and makes it very easy to do more complicated layouts (tables, columns, etc.) and there are now more step options in the automated programs than we've seen in other marketing automation software (for example alerting sales reps individually of prospect activity via our CRM).  integration with our CRM was also very seamless.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I  wish you could easily preview an email in your browser and different browsers before sending to ensure the layout looks correct.  Currently you have to send a test email to see how it looks.  The social media publisher could be improved slightly as sometimes can be a little buggy, for example by providing an option to not include an image for LI and FB posts would be helpful.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Definitely worth a try.  Once you start using it you won't want to stop!

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Several marketing and sales problems are being solved.  For example we now have the ability to easily nurture suspects and to see what content they are engaging with and which web pages visited etc..  This provides sales with more useful information as they convert to prospects and into sales ready leads. Marketing users also find the platform easy and efficient to use, saving time, enabling more campaigns to be sent.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The software itself was pretty good. We would have loved to continue using the software and take full advantage of what it has to offer.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Aggressive, high-pressure sales calls and smoke and mirror games about getting discounted prices. Ultimately though, Act-On offered us a discount, but did not disclose what future upgrade costs would be. We made our needs of what the client count would have to be clear before we signed up, but they convinced us to sign up in a lower tier to meet our budget and close the deal. But then after 3-4 months of set-up and training, we finally went to use the software in practice and needed to upgrade # of clients to actually utilize the system, and then were met with the reality of the situation. They had no intent of accommodating our original needs at the budget we discussed and tried to double our cost to get to the original needs we discussed. Even though they admitted that they were vague and unclear in the agreement on the upgrade details, they refused to accommodate our needs/budget or to let us out of our contract and instead chose to simply state that we were still bound to pay for the software until the end of the term, even though they know we won't even be able to utilize the service. Pretty poor service and they are only thinking in the short-term about making a few bucks instead of working with us to save the account.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Be careful to get your growth plan and rates for future growth identified in your initial contract. Don't sign up unless you know what rates they will charge you in the future if you need to upgrade client #s.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
E-mail marketing automation.

Hubspot is the only other product I really considered, but just didn't think I could justify the cost and hassle.

What do you like best about Act-On?
It has all the power of some of the biggest players in the industry, with a much more usable interface. Integration with Salesforce is tight and seamless. Automated Programs are excellent and flexible, and include push / pulls to Salesforce. Email tool is fantastic and easy to schedule future mailings, and their built in templates and wysiwyg editor is top notch. Their support organization is spot on. Love the no-contract, month-to-month model they espouse. Great company, great software.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
My only criticism of Act-On is their UI could be prettier. From a usability / functionality standpoint, it's excellent, so if it were a trade-off, I would keep usability!

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Take their demos, talk to their support and training departments - if you're not an advanced user of marketing automation, it doesn't matter. You'll find they will be very helpful in getting you set up. If you're a larger organization, Act-On would still be fantastic - and it would be great to try them out, since they're only month-to-month! That being said, I've been a customer for about 1 1/2 years, but they take great care of you since they can't lock you into a contract and forget about you until you're up for renewal.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a very limited staff (down to 3), and only part of my time can be focused on demand gen efforts, email marketing, database marketing, etc. Also, we needed forms that would be trackable and push to Salesforce automatically. We also wanted to quickly add landing pages, and be able to track users so our salespeople can see our lead scores. Act-On provided these in glorious fashion.

all_reviews.review_title: Marketing Automation That Grows With Your Company
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
CRM Integration:
The fact that Act-On seamlessly integrates with our CRM (Salesforce.com) is incredible. It gives us the ability to move all of our lead database from one tool to another and update all of that information hourly or in real time. We are able to easily prioritize our "hot leads" and sort our lead database by lead score without leaving Salesforce.

Analytics and Reporting:
The analytics and reporting tools offered are extremely helpful and easy to use. After a campaign is started, webinar hosted,  or an email is sent you can see real-time results and customize, sort, or download the results.

Reverse IP Lookup Reports:
This is a great feature that produces daily website visitor reports that can be configured to go out to specific reps in the field and only contain website visitors from their territory. Having the ability to see exactly what companies or which marketing prospects are visiting your website is a game-changer.


What do you dislike about Act-On?
Templates:
Many of the templates for both emails and landing pages are too generic and bland. It would be nice to have a drag and drop feature which I believe this is coming in a new release).


Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I highly recommend Act-on, not only for its intuitive layout and ease to use, but because they deliver high-quality, reliable customer service.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before Act-On we were sending about 20,000 emails a month, had no lead scoring system in place, no integration with our CRM system, and were not tracking website visitor data outside of Google Analytics.

Now we are able to send over 150,000 emails monthly with high deliverablity. Our lead scoring system has helped make our sales team more efficient and arms them with more customer information and data before they contact a potential prospect. We have full visibility of our website visitors and their behaviors on our site and social media.

This is one of the best options out there for small businesses. We compared prices and capabilities and this is really a terrific value for all of the practical features. Act-On also integrates with all of our outside platforms (webinars, salesforce, outlook, google, etc).

I'd also like to see the ability to message in local time zones rather than sending at a central time zone.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
They have an excellent support team. They are patient and take as much or as little time as you need to ensure you start off successfully. What's more - they continually check in on you. You're not a number or a dollar sign - you're a real customer and speaking to real people.

It's also an incredibly easy tool to use. I think this is a perfect fit for a wide range of organizations.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before using Act-On we were sending email in the blind and our efforts largely untracked. With Act-On we now have more visibility into what is really going on with our data. We can segment and tailor messages, and we can do so much more. We also now have the ability to capture and nurture leads. Something we never had the ability to do before.

They commit themselves to you, your goals, and your individual needs, level of experience, and preferences. Kudos to them in realizing that marketing automation is a term, and the only thing that should be automated should be the system, not the customer service.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Salesforce integration helps sales prioritize leads and hot prospects with activity reports and Hot Prospect reports (all without leaving Salesforce). Ability to create and send html emails and newsletters to targeted lists (we no longer need the web team to develop html emails). Website activity and email reports provide valuable feedback on open, click and deliverability rates so we can track, analyze and act on the data. Pre-designed templates allow the sales team to quickly send emails from Salesforce to a hot prospect based on where they are at in the sales process. It's easy to create landing pages and forms (with automatic thank you emails) that we link to our website, and we can edit them within minutes. Trigger/drip marketing campaigns allow us to stay in touch with our customers and prospects with targeted content. Most important, Act-on provides a level of service, training, and customer support that is far better than any vendor I've worked with in the past. Everyone we've worked with at Act-on is highly professional, friendly and knowledgeable, and there when we need them.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Entering generic email aliases can be time consuming as you have to enter each one individually versus downloading a list.  We could like to have the ability for  revenue attribution and revenue impact reports automatically emailed to key people; similar to the website activity reports we get daily.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I highly recommend Act-on, not only for its ease of use, but because they place an emphasis on delivering high-quality, reliable customer service. While no matter what marketing automation service you choose will not be 100% perfect, Act-on continues to exceed our needs and is always looking for ways to improve and provide ROI.

I'm able to track my prospects activity on a daily basis, I'm able integrate many of their tools within my website, like gate-keeping content and requiring name/email to download our white papers, I'm saving money using their forms for our event registration rather than going through a 3rd party, and our sales team can be notified when their leads are on our website.  This gives us much better information for follow-up than before.  We were blind to all of this information before act-on.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The Act-On / SalesForce integration makes tracking email marketing efforts in our SalesForce database very user-friendly. (even for the sales team!)

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I'm not a fan of the email marketing templates.  I would prefer an easier drag and drop format for creating emails.

Give yourself an entire day to devote to setting up test campaigns, test emails, test forms, etc... Map out your "test" objective i.e. register for seminar webform and register for seminar email and thank you for registering automated response.  Then take your time playing around with the tool.  Call support, get familiar with their process.  Just don't wait until an hour before you have to set up a registration form and an email campaign to learn the system and call support.  It's less frustrating to test drive when you're not in a jam and you'll retain the knowledge better.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were spending a lot of money on marketing but unable to track it effectively.  There were also a lot of extra steps to gather data to help the sales team know what prospects were engaging with our email and internet marketing activities.  By switching to Act-On, integrating it with SalesForce and setting up marketing automation campaigns our sales team can easily assess what prospects are hot and our marketing team can get a quick overview of what marketing activities the audience is responding to.

I dislike the trouble we have getting through our clients spam filters. We are told a lot of the times that our emails were not received.

We have talked through this issue and have implemented some filters through which our list can go to select "engaged" people first. The people we know are opening our emails. This is beneficial so the list gets shorter, therefore hopefully not as big of a target to spam bots.

all_reviews.review_title: Tedious But Eventually Generates Some Results
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On is great for getting feedback on deliverables and forms, and it allows me to see what kind of collaterals work versus which ones are unpopular.  Like all marketing automation tools, I'm also able to track potential prospects by their engagement ratio with the content I send out. This allows me to say, for example, target a certain type of "profile" who is consistently engaging with content- whether it be in email campaigns, newsletters, or invitations to webinars.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Unfortunately, there are many things I would like Act-On to do that it currently doesn't. For example, it does not allow me to continuously update a scoring list when certain prospects fall within a certain threshold; I have to manually import them which is tedious and requires close study of their behavior. Additionally, Act-On hinders me creatively as a marketer because the email templates, while relatively straight-forward, do not allow for any advanced graphics. In fact, most graphics do not appear except when opened in a browser, an extra step that many prospects may not want to complete.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm solving the problem of finding prospects to generate into leads for sales.  I feel like Act-On has given me a luke-warm methodology of accomplishing this, though it has allowed me to realize what content I continue to market successfully and which kinds need more development.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
1) I like the ability to quickly see in real time the number of individuals responding and the open rates.
2) Very reasonably priced and having subscription revised to reflect actual usage is a snap
3) Integration with Salesforce marketing lists
4) Salesforce integrated dashboard

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Unable to download an easy report to see which email addresses (with first and last name fields) have bounced.
1) If you have regular bounces, you can only download either (a) a report of just email addresses or (b) you have to look email-by-email and download reports of which addresses bounced. That provides you a first and last name.  Same thing with soft bounces - no detailed soft bounced report. These would be SUPER VALUABLE to me in having my team look up and call people for current emails.

2) Automated programming is confusing. It needs to have a step-by-step setup wizard designed to make it dummy proof. Although I understand computer logic (from 30 years ago in college) it's difficult to map out on your own every single step that you might want a program to take, and even m ore difficult to run it in some kind of test mode to make sure it is working. It's basically impossible to test. Even automated programs that I have had set up entirely by act-on staff have had flaws in them resulting in incorrect emails being sent out or multiple daily emails. Basically glitches that should be eliminated through creating a step-by-step help-you-build-it wizard that asks you questions and builds a diagram flow chart for you.


Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Continually working to improve the product which is important.

We rely on the data provided for marketing reports to clients. It creates a nice history that integrates with Salesforce. We find the click through data highly valuable.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Inbound Marketing: We use this extensively to determine the activity on our web site. We get a good sense of which search terms are working, Google Paid Per Click tracking, referring sites (so that we can say thanks in some cases), and alert us when someone of significance is back on our site. Marketing List Management: The segmentation aspects are very nice. We are able to easily segment lists and be sure that we are targeting specific people or groups.
Dashboard: The main screen for all things going on. It's a good quick read on what's happening on various marketing campaigns and initiatives. Ease of Use: The system is just easy to use. I was concerned about not knowing enough when we embarked on this journey but the system is designed so that most can get up and going fairly quickly due in large part to it's user interface which is very clean.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Templates: If you are coming from some email marketing systems (like Constant Contact, Mail Chimp, SwiftPage) you won't find a very heavy library of visually pleasing starter templates to modify and configure. It's very basic but does get the job done. Partner Program: There is not a large partner channel set up right now. They are working on it and have efforts to build this out in short order but it is something to be mindful of in your evaluation. They have a super staff and onboarding experience but if you are looking for more than "how to" in terms of working in the program and need "marketing best practices" or moving beyond "where to click" guidance, the supply of trusted providers is short.

Reporting: This tool has made us better at marketing because it provides us key areas to analyze and act on now (pardon the pun) Increased site visits and conversions: We have now begun to be able to pull more people in and know when it's best to react to a buyers journey. all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
From sales to support, I've been most impressed with their customer service. Their staff is COMPLETELY aligned with your projects/goals.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
Marketing automation is complicated and confusing by nature. The software isn't perfect because the industry is growing and changing all the time. It makes sense. However, the user experience is not as convenient or comprehensive as it's sold to be. I don't say this to discredit Act-On by any means, I only intend to say that marketing automation is A LOT of work.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
After understanding Act-On's capabilities and having worked within the software, I encourage most people to look into marketing automation. I believe in it. Act-On was the most realistically priced software platform for our agency (contacts/investment) and the experience has been great so far. Marketing automation is a crazy world to enter if you don't know anything about it. The Act-On staff has helped us through all of the questions we've ever had about our online marketing projects and they're extremely diligent about customer satisfaction. I don't have experience with any other platform but, I'll say, based on customer service, pricing, and independent research, Act-On might hand you the most for your money.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-On has helped our company define absolute online marketing objectives and standards which have become extremely valuable internally--they have reshaped our general view of online marketing and, since we build websites, it has changed the way we work. Marketing Automation is a new philosophy for and Act-On is a new service we can sell. Our working understanding of the software has dramatically changed our project goals and sales conversations.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful Tool for Marketing/Sales Goal Alignment
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Act-On is ideal for a company like ours focused on tightly aligning marketing strategy with sales revenue goals. We're a relatively small company of about 30 employees, but are pursuing a very aggressive growth strategy. Act-On was not only easy to implement and use, but the customer success reps have been very hands-on helping us maximize the value of the software. That is extremely important for a sales and marketing organization of our size - with only 12 people.

Act-On centralizes all of our marketing function, including email, Webinar, ad landing pages, social media, drip campaigns, etc. into one platform, allowing me to easily measure the value of a particular message, medium or channel to ensure that we're spending our marketing budget wisely. Perhaps, more importantly, it generates quality, actionable leads by helping my sales team see which Salesforce prospects are really engaged with us in order to prioritize their selling. This feature has really helped us get more value out of Salesforce.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I wish we had a more standardized set up of Salesforce. We had overly customized it, which requires some tweaking when we sync certain fields with Act-On.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
Act-On has a very low, fairly risk-free start-up cost. The team there is dedicated to making sure that you are set-up and see value immediately. Start with a trial or even a few month pilot with enthusiastic sales people to prove the value to the rest. We started small, then increased our commitment level four-fold because the leadership team saw the value for the marketing, sales and now customer service teams.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our goal is to accelerate growth in a new market to boost sales revenues and market share. Act-On has not only served as an essential marketing tool to help us increase brand awareness and lead generation, but it has also helped the sales team prospect, prioritize and upsell better because of the system's capabilities and the information available to them through the Salesforce integration.

all_reviews.review_title: Act-On Made Me Look Like A Rockstar
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
The system is extremely easy to get up and running with minimal technical/backend manipulations. Carlos Reyes, our technical account manager, was unbelievably helpful. In 6 weeks I was able to completely configure and integrate Act-On with the company website, social networks, WebEx, and Salesforce. I was also able to build out all standard email templates for sales reps and marketing campaigns; create and go-live with all forms on the website including automated email responses and notifications.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
The form builder does not have some advanced features that would have helped us capture lead information more efficiently. For example, it would have been nice to have the Country, State and City picklists be related such that if I select "Canada" as my country, the Canadian providences and territories populate the State field picklist. If I select United States as the Country, I want the State field picklist to show the 50 states.

It was not easy to apply our company style guide to the forms that we created in Act-On. Even using Act-On professional services, it took over a week to create the style template that we could apply to all of our forms.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I definitely recommend using Act-On over Loopfuse, Benchmark Email, and MailChimp. If you are a small shop with minimal manpower, I would definitely choose Act-On over Marketo.

What problems is Act-On solving and how is that benefiting you?
Act-on helped us track leads from first contact to close of sale. That is something we were not able to accomplish with our legacy systems. We used to use Loopfuse for marketing campaigns and LeadLander for website tracking but nothing was fully connected with our Salesforce account which was where sales and marketing needed to track and log activity.

all_reviews.review_title: Are You Looking For A User-Friendly, Customer-Centric Marketing Automation Platform?
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Act-On?
Next month will be the one year anniversary of decommissioning a competing vendor platform and transitioning to Act-On. I have to admit - one of the best decisions made during last planning season. When partnering with Act-On, you are appointed a Customer Success Manager that, for a lack of a better term, "Simplifies" your life with superior coaching, seasoned advice and hands-on support throughout every step of the transition/implementation process to building out your marketing lists to launching your first campaign and well beyond. Several times throughout the past year, I was presented with robust account reviews that assessed recent campaigns, usage practices/stats and offered up top notch thought leadership and best practices on system usage that has drastically reduced our campaign creation time while increasing efficiency.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
I have yet to come across an element of the platform that I dislike, but there are a few features that would be nice if implemented. Within the dashboard reporting suite, you are presented with a number of graphical representations of your campaign data. You are given the ability to download the data as a whole and/or broken into segments by clicking the area of the graph in which you would like to observe further. I wish you were given the ability to export the graphs to be able to plug into your marketing reports as you find yourself recreating them for the most part in your campaign status reports.

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
If you are considering adopting or transitioning to a new marketing automation platform - I would advise you to demo the Act-On platform to check out the following features:
1. The automated programs feature (the design is so user friendly)
2. The reporting segmentation with rapid click follow-up (one click on a segment of a campaign report and you are prompted to a follow-up feature)
3. The Act-On dashboard within Salesforce CRM (The integration give you a robust dashboard within a lead or contact record and also has an amazing hot prospects tool that any sales person would want)
4. The New In-Bound platform (merging your SEO/SEM initiatives into your out-bound automation campaigns)

What do you like best about Act-On?
No long term commitment and clear price transparency.  (Some of their competitors nickel/dime you to death with fine print and add-on items, plus lock you into a long-term commitment without even allowing you to test to see if the solution is right for you!)

Acton also has some pretty amazing support, great features (e.g. email system is second to none, WebEx integration) and success coaches help to ensure you leverage every aspect of the Acton system and the tools of marketing automation/lead generation.

What do you dislike about Act-On?
If you are new to marketing automation the set up can be a little daunting.  The interface makes it easy (and working with your success coach will streamline the learning curve), but it's critical you have your marketing funnels and drip campaigns ironed out BEFORE you get on Acton.

Also, I found their social media integration weak at best.  However, given that really none of the competitors in the automation/lead gen industry are doing any better it was something that I could easily overcome.  Just simply work with a more powerful social media dashboard.  Simple.

One thing I would love for Acton to integrete, however would be a more central dashboard for analytics, even if these where API driven.  Even with their great analytics center, there is still data from social media and outbound marketing activities that would be nice to track within the Acton platform.  (But that's more of a wishlist vs. a problem.)

Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
I've worked with many of the marketing automation platforms out there even at an enterprise level.  What I really love about Acton is that it is a "grow with me" system which is perfect for small businesses who are serious about growing and midsize businesses who want the bells and whistles of an enterprise system.

Additionally Acton is top-notch when it comes to making things work smoothly.  With some of the other automation systems out there, it feels disjointed, bulky and cumbersome.  Also Acton understands that extraordinary marketing involves both proactive (direct or interruption) marketing and attraction (inbound) marketing to be truly successful. The email system is powerful and the idea that you can connect your follow-up programs to a WebEx invitation makes Acton clearly the winner.

Overall I couldn't recommend a better company or solution and our sales manager at Acton, Brandon absolutely rocks!!!  :)  Don't tinker further...just sign up.  When you do you'll find out what you've been missing and what you need to make your online marketing more trackable, interactive and effective!  And hey, getting great ROI is the icing on the cake!

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Act-On?
review_question_answers.answer:
If you are new to marketing automation the set up can be a little daunting.  The interface makes it easy (and working with your success coach will streamline the learning curve), but it's critical you have your marketing funnels and drip campaigns ironed out BEFORE you get on Acton.

Also, I found their social media integration weak at best.  However, given that really none of the competitors in the automation/lead gen industry are doing any better it was something that I could easily overcome.  Just simply work with a more powerful social media dashboard.  Simple.

One thing I would love for Acton to integrete, however would be a more central dashboard for analytics, even if these where API driven.  Even with their great analytics center, there is still data from social media and outbound marketing activities that would be nice to track within the Acton platform.  (But that's more of a wishlist vs. a problem.)

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Act-On:
review_question_answers.answer:
I've worked with many of the marketing automation platforms out there even at an enterprise level.  What I really love about Acton is that it is a "grow with me" system which is perfect for small businesses who are serious about growing and midsize businesses who want the bells and whistles of an enterprise system.

Additionally Acton is top-notch when it comes to making things work smoothly.  With some of the other automation systems out there, it feels disjointed, bulky and cumbersome.  Also Acton understands that extraordinary marketing involves both proactive (direct or interruption) marketing and attraction (inbound) marketing to be truly successful. The email system is powerful and the idea that you can connect your follow-up programs to a WebEx invitation makes Acton clearly the winner.

Overall I couldn't recommend a better company or solution and our sales manager at Acton, Brandon absolutely rocks!!!  :)  Don't tinker further...just sign up.  When you do you'll find out what you've been missing and what you need to make your online marketing more trackable, interactive and effective!  And hey, getting great ROI is the icing on the cake!
